rev.comment: /* Statements regarding Barack Obama and backlash */
rev.diff:
Line 242: Line 242:
Trump has promoted the [[Barack Obama citizenship conspiracy theories|conspiracy theories about Obama's citizenship status]] in media appearances, and he has received criticism for his position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Donald Trump, birther?|url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/51473.html#ixzz1GsPWRHLL|first=Kendra|last=Marr|work=[[Politico (newspaper)|Politico]]|date=March 17, 2011}}</ref><ref name=MacNicol>Glynnis MacNicol, [http://www.businessinsider.com/trump-birther-obama-muslim-video-2011-3 "TRUMP: Maybe Obama's Missing Birth Certificate Says He's A Muslim"], ''[[Business Insider]]'' 30 March 2011</ref> In an [[NBC-TV]] interview broadcast on April 7, 2011, Trump said he would not let go of the issue, because he was not satisfied that Obama had proven his citizenship.<ref name=WashPost4711>{{Cite news|title=Trump goes after Obama on US citizenship, says citizenship questions remain unanswered|date=April 7, 2011|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[The Washington Post]]|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 7, 2011}}</ref>
Trump has promoted the [[Barack Obama citizenship conspiracy theories|conspiracy theories about Obama's citizenship status]] in media appearances, and he has received criticism for his position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Donald Trump, birther?|url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/51473.html#ixzz1GsPWRHLL|first=Kendra|last=Marr|work=[[Politico (newspaper)|Politico]]|date=March 17, 2011}}</ref><ref name=MacNicol>Glynnis MacNicol, [http://www.businessinsider.com/trump-birther-obama-muslim-video-2011-3 "TRUMP: Maybe Obama's Missing Birth Certificate Says He's A Muslim"], ''[[Business Insider]]'' 30 March 2011</ref> In an [[NBC-TV]] interview broadcast on April 7, 2011, Trump said he would not let go of the issue, because he was not satisfied that Obama had proven his citizenship.<ref name=WashPost4711>{{Cite news|title=Trump goes after Obama on US citizenship, says citizenship questions remain unanswered|date=April 7, 2011|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[The Washington Post]]|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 7, 2011}}</ref>
â
On April 25, 2011 on [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]], Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump has received criticism from both the right and the left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref>On April 27, Trump held a press conference expressing pride at his role in the release of the long-form of Obama's birth certificate.
+
On April 25, 2011 on [[Anderson Cooper 360]] on [[CNN]], Trump said he wanted Obama to end the issue by releasing a long form Certificate of Live Birth (distinct from the short form Certification of Live Birth, which is Hawaii's prima facie evidence of birth).<ref>{{cite web|title= Obama's Birth Certificate |url= http://urbanlegends.about.com/od/barackobama/a/obama_birth_certificate.htm |last=Emery |first=David |work=About.com |date=March 30, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title= Birtherism: Where It All Began|url= http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0411/53563_Page3.html |work=The Politico |date=April 22, 2011 |accessdate=April 25, 2011}}</ref> Trump has received criticism from both the right and the left in the media for his stance.<ref name=Politico33011>{{Cite news|last=Haberman |first=Maggie |title=Bill O'Reilly pounds birther Donald Trump |url=http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0311/52271.html |date=March 30, 2011|work=Polico.com|separator=,|postscript=|accessdate=April 13, 2011}}</ref>On April 27, Trump held a press conference expressing pride at his role in the release of the long-form of Obama's birth certificate. Trump's remarks have been widely and notably accused of the presumped candidate of a controversial pattern of behavior. Original copies of the comments by Scheiffer, Zakari, and others are available online.
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump raised the question whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/>
In the April 27 press conference, after the birth certificate was released by Obama, Trump raised the question whether Obama's college grades were sufficient for Harvard admission and called for the release of Obama's transcripts from Occidental College.<ref>[http://nation.foxnews.com/donald-trump/2011/04/08/msnbc-host-wants-parent-company-fire-trump MSNBC Host Wants Parent Company to Fire Trump] [http://washingtonscene.thehill.com/in-the-know/36-news/9131-weiner-nbc-should-tell-trump-youre-fired Weiner: NBC Should Tell Trump "You're Fired"]</ref><ref name=Schieffer>{{cite news|author=Schieffer, Bob|title=Schieffer: Racism underlying Trump's assertions|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20058072-503544.html|date=April 27, 2011|work=CBS News|publisher=CBS Interactive|accessdate=April 27, 2011}}</ref> Trump's statements were criticized by commentators and comedians.<ref name=Cina>{{cite news|author=Cina, Mark|title=Who Hates Donald Trump Most in Hollywood Now|date=April 29, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/who-hates-donald-trump-hollywood-183731|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Miller, Daniel|title=Donald Trump's 'Celebrity Apprentice': Why Only One Advertiser Has Fired Him (Analysis)|date=May 3, 2011|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/donald-trumps-celebrity-apprentice-why-184320|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name=Schieffer/>
â   â
Trump's remarks have been widely and notably accused of the presumped candidate of a controversial pattern of behavior. Original text of the comments by Scheiffer, Zakari, and others for their reporting on Trump.
